metadata.Title: CVE-2009-3637 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the M_AddToServerList function in client/menu.c in Red Planet Arena Alien Arena 7.30 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a packet with a crafted server description to UDP port 27901 followed by a packet with a long print command.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-3637` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

alien-arena - 7.33-1
alien-arena-server - 7.33-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: alien-arena package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.33-1').
